New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns became the last Knicks player since the great Patrick Ewing to collect over 30 points and 20 rebounds in multiple games in a single season.
Key Match Events: The home team outscored Utah 32-21 in the second quarter to take control.
Utah cut a 10-point halftime lead to 8 after the third quarter, led by Colin Sextonâ€™s efficiency.
Josh Hart used his energy en route to a triple-double (15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists).
Pre-Game Insights: No Jalen Brunson and Deuce McBride? No problem.
Post-Match Reflections: The red-hot 24-10 New York Knicks are now just 0.5 games behind the Atlantic Division-leading Boston Celtics (24-9).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York Knicks won their ninth straight game on Wednesday night, courtesy of a comfortable 119-103 win over the Utah Jazz at Madison Square Garden.
Cameron Payne got the start at point guard and played 36 minutes.
Newcomer Landry Shamet played 11 minutes (2 points), whereas rookie Tyler Kolek also scored 2 points while chipping in with 4 assists in his 11 minutes.
Others: The team will next turn their attention to a Friday night road game against the Oklahoma City Thunder, where old friend Isaiah Hartenstein awaits.
